page.title: 11Ecology around Ripe
page.content: Flowers are mostly confined to the road verges as farmers use weedkillers in the fields. All through the year from the Spring primroses and bluebells to the Autumn teasles there is a carpet of colourfull wild flowers along the wide verges. { Animals. Rabbits abound in every bank some of which are caught by foxes, stoats and weasles. Badgers also burrow in the banks and more prolific are the rats, mice, voles, moles and fieldmice. Mink are now endemic as there is plenty of food if they escape from a mink farm. They are found by streams and are a menace as they kill domestic chickens and ducks. Birds are abundant and the seasons see the changes as some migrate to warmer places for Winter and some return from the colder North.
